tool.name: SummarizeRastersTool

param.name: in_ply
param.dialogReference: Polygon feature class that will be used to summarize raster values.

param.name: in_fc_join_field
param.dialogReference: Attribute field in the input polygon feature class which stores unique values for each polygon feature. The values in this field will be add to a new field in the output feature class called ZONE_INDEX.

param.name: bool_overlap
param.displayname: Do the input polygon features overlap (e.g. upstream catchments)?
param.dialogReference: When checked, the Summarize Rasters tool will iterate through the input polygon feature class and summarize raster values for each polygon feature separately. Choosing this option will significantly increase tool processing time.

param.name: stat_list
param.expression: Raster Dataset {Statistic Type} {Summary Field Name};Raster Dataset {Statistic Type} {Summary Field Name}...
param.dialogReference:
Each raster dataset to be summarized must be added as an entry in the summary parameter data list.

  • Raster Dataset: Browse and add a local raster dataset file

  • Statistic Type: Choose one of the available summary statistic types from the list

  • Summary Field Name: Type in the name of the new attribute field which will store the summarized values for this raster dataset

param.name: out_fc
param.dialogReference: The output polygon feature class that will be generated by the Summarize Rasters tool. Each summarized raster dataset will result in a new attribute field in this feature class.

tool.summary: The Summarize Rasters tool takes any polygon dataset as an input, and statistically summarizes user-selected attributes per polygon feature for one or more raster datasetsthat intersect that polygon. As an example, the user could specify a polygon datasetrepresenting watersheds. The tool could calculate the mean elevation found within eachwatershed polygon, based on a spatially coincident digital elevation model.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Summarize Rasters tool takes any polygon dataset as an input, and statistically summarizes user-selected attributes per polygon feature for one or more raster datasetsthat intersect that polygon. As an example, the user could specify a polygon datasetrepresenting watersheds. The tool could calculate the mean elevation found within eachwatershed polygon, based on a spatially coincident digital elevation model.
